comment: Honestly, She is flexible with due dates at least with my class. She is your average professor. But her accent is very thick and I don't understand what she's saying, along with the speed she moves with new material and units. If possible, I would have chosen another professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: a great professor. she does have an accent, but she provides videos from another professor going through the same lectures and worksheets on d2l, which makes it easier to follow along. she teaches using worksheets with lots of examples and practice problems that help reinforce the material. aleks hw every week, but you can retry until you get 100.
Does not know how to teach. Does not care if you understand or not. She's knowledgeable and know how to do it, however does not know how to teach it to students
She's a great professor. She does have an accent but you can still understand her. I would say class was only hard because it's stats which is... -_-

She teaches in a clear and engaging manner Shes respectful when questions are asked and answers them in an easy to understand way. By all means, I'm not a math genius but the way she teaches is amazing attendance isn't mandatory but if you go to most classes you get a whole point added to your grade at the end of the semester Responds to email fast

She is a very harsh professor. She does not ever review exams after grading and only teaches from one sheet of paper for every unit; exams usually have questions not on the homework or on the teacher's notes. She expects you to write answers a certain way and will count them as incorrect if you do not phrase things properly. Do not take this class.

Her class was good. As long as you pay attention, her lectures are clear and she repeats herself many times on what methods to use. She is good at explaining, but like most math classes it really is important that you go! Tests are fairly easy and are similar to the study guide and review. I would take her again!
